page.title: 04Cannock Chase Country Park
page.content: Part of the Country Park lies within our survey block. It is an area of heathland where hills and valleys are crossed by many narrow paths. Heather, bracken and gorse abound, and silver birch, hawthorn and pine trees can be seen. The whole area is excellent for walking and for picnics. On Anson's Bank special car parking and picnic areas have been provided. A local firm have paid for a toposcope which is engraved onto a sheet of aluminium and specially water-proofed, and fixed to a boulder. From this vantage point many distant landmarks can be seen. Wild life abounds: many species of birds, fallow deer, and small mammals can be seen. Occasionally snakes, including adders, are to be found.
